content.text: CSS Conic Gradients
CSS Conic Gradients
A conic gradient is a gradient with color transitions rotated around a center point.
content.html: A conic gradient is a gradient with color transitions rotated around a center point.

content.text: To create a conic gradient you must define at least two colors.
content.html: To create a conic gradient you must define at least two colors.

content.text: Syntax

content.code_html: background-image: conic-gradient([from angle] [at position,] color [degree], color [degree], ...);

content.text: By default, angle is 0deg and position is center.
If no degree is specified, the colors will be spread equally around the center point.
content.html: If no degree is specified, the colors will be spread equally around the center point.

content.text: Conic Gradient: Three Colors
The following example shows a conic gradient with three colors:
content.html: The following example shows a conic gradient with three colors:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green);
}

content.text: Conic Gradient: Five Colors
The following example shows a conic gradient with five colors:
content.html: The following example shows a conic gradient with five colors:

syntaxHighlighting.text: #grad {  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);}
background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);

content.code: #grad {  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);}

syntax_highlighting.text: #grad {  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);}
background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: #grad {  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);}
background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);

content.text: Conic Gradient: Three Colors and Degrees
The following example shows a conic gradient with three colors and a degree for each color:
content.html: The following example shows a conic gradient with three colors and a degree for each color:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(red 45deg, yellow 90deg, green 210deg);
}

content.text: Create Pie Charts
Just add border-radius: 50% to make the conic gradient look like a pie:
content.html: Just add border-radius: 50% to make the conic gradient look like a pie:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(red, yellow, green, blue, black);
  border-radius: 50%;
}

content.text: Here is another pie chart with defined degrees for all the colors:
content.html: Here is another pie chart with defined degrees for all the colors:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
: conic-gradient(red 0deg, red 90deg, yellow 90deg, yellow 
    180deg, green 180deg, green 270deg, blue 270deg);

syntax_highlighting.text:
: conic-gradient(red 0deg, red 90deg, yellow 90deg, yellow 
    180deg, green 180deg, green 270deg, blue 270deg);

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(red 0deg, red 90deg, yellow 90deg, yellow 180deg, green 180deg, green 270deg, blue 270deg);
  border-radius: 50%;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
: conic-gradient(red 0deg, red 90deg, yellow 90deg, yellow 
    180deg, green 180deg, green 270deg, blue 270deg);

content.text: Conic Gradient With Specified From Angle
The [from angle ] specifies an angle that the entire conic gradient is rotated by.
content.html: The [from angle] specifies an angle that the entire conic gradient is rotated by.

content.text: The following example shows a conic gradient with a from angle of 90deg:
content.html: The following example shows a conic gradient with a from angle of 90deg:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(from 90deg, red, yellow, green);
}

content.text: Conic Gradient With Specified Center Position
The [at position ] specifies the center of the conic gradient.
content.html: The [at position] specifies the center of the conic gradient.

content.text: The following example shows a conic gradient with a center position of 60% 45%:
content.html: The following example shows a conic gradient with a center position of 60% 45%:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: conic-gradient(at 60% 45%, red, yellow, green);
}

content.text: Repeating a Conic Gradient
The repeating-conic-gradient() function is used to repeat conic gradients:
content.html: The repeating-conic-gradient() function is used to repeat conic gradients:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: repeating-conic-gradient(red 10%, yellow 20%);
  border-radius: 50%;
}

content.text: Here is a repeating conic gradient with defined color-starts and color-stops:
content.html: Here is a repeating conic gradient with defined color-starts and color-stops:

content.code_html:
#grad {
  background-image: repeating-conic-gradient(red 0deg 10deg, yellow 10deg 20deg, blue 20deg 30deg);
  border-radius: 50%;
}

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the default center position for a conic gradient?
content.html: What is the default center position for a conic gradient?

metadata.question: What is the default center position for a conic gradient?

content.question: What is the default center position for a conic gradient?

content.text: CSS Gradient Functions
The following table lists the CSS gradient functions:
content.html: The following table lists the CSS gradient functions:

content.code_html:
Function Description
conic-gradient() Creates a conic gradient. Define at least two colors (around a center point)
linear-gradient() Creates a linear gradient. Define at least two colors (top to bottom)
radial-gradient() Creates a radial gradient. Define at least two colors (center to edges)
repeating-conic-gradient() Repeats a conic gradient
repeating-linear-gradient() Repeats a linear gradient
repeating-radial-gradient() Repeats a radial gradient
